MmCallHdl Class Reference

Class to establish and release Mm calls. Calls are identified by a call_index. More...

Detailed Description

Class to establish and release Mm calls. Calls are identified by a call_index.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MmCallHdl::MmCallHdl (  CallIndex  call_index = c_null_call_index  ) 
 

Creates a well-initialized MmCallHdl object.

Parameters:
call_index A reference to a call. If omitted, which is the standard case, c_null_call_index is used by default.

MmCallHdl::~MmCallHdl (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

CallApiRc MmCallHdl::Accept (   ) 
 

Accepts an incoming (mobile terminated) multimedia call. Returns NoError if it has been successfully accepted. A CallEventMsg is sent after having established an MTC. Refer to the documentation of CallApiRc for a detailed description of the return values.

Returns:
NoError - If executed successfully. In case of error one of the following values will be returned: CallDataLocked, ActiveCallDetected, InvalidCallIndex, VoidCallIndex or CallDisconnected.

void MmCallHdl::DisconnectActivePsdCalls (   )  [static]
 

Disconnects all active psd calls

TimeSpan MmCallHdl::GetCallDuration (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a TimeSpan object for the duration of the call represented by an MmCallHdl. The method is applicable to MmCallHdl.

Returns:
A zero value if the MmCallHdl is not valid. Also zero if a single call has not been successfully established. The time span from the successful establishment of of a single call or multiparty call to the time of execution of this method.

virtual CallIndex MmCallHdl::GetCallIndex (   )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Returns:
the call index of the MmCallHdl object.

CallType MmCallHdl::GetCallType (   )  const
 

Returns:
The CallType of the call

ClirMode MmCallHdl::GetClirMode (   )  const
 

Returns:
The ClirMode which has been used for MOC setup

const PhoneNumber & MmCallHdl::GetConnectedToPhoneNumber (   )  const
 

Returns a reference to a PhoneNumber object where a mobile originated call is actually connected to. If the dialled number is equal to the connected to number, the return value is identical to the return of GetPhoneNumber(). If applied to an MmCallHdl which represents an MTC the return value is equal to the return value of GetPhoneNumber(). The MmCallHdl shall contain a valid CallIndex!!

See also:
GetPhoneNumber().
Returns:
A constant reference to a PhoneNumber.

CallApiRc MmCallHdl::GetCurrentCallMeter (   ) 
 

Initiates the sending of the message MmCurrentCallMeterMsg for one time, if the respective call exists.

Returns:
VoidCallIndex if the MmCallHdl is not valid any more, SupplementaryService failed if AoC is not supported for this call, NoError otherwise.

CallApiRc MmCallHdl::GetCurrentChargeData (   ) 
 

Initiates the sending of the message MmCurrentChargeDataMsg for one time if the respective call exists.

Returns:
VoidCallIndex if the CallHdl is not valid any more, SupplementaryService failed if AoC is not supported for this call, NoError otherwise.

const PhoneNumber & MmCallHdl::GetPhoneNumber (   )  const
 

Returns a reference to a PhoneNumber object containing the phone number of a MOC or MTC. If the phone number has not yet been transmitted by network, the returned PhoneNumber is empty (MTC). If invoked during the setup phase of a MOC, the return value is the dialled phone number. The MmCallHdl shall contain a valid CallIndex, i.e., c_null_call_index < CallIndex < c_max_calls.

Returns:
A constant reference to a PhoneNumber.

Socket * MmCallHdl::GetSocket (   )  const
 

Returns the socket for the data connection. Write and Read methods at the returned socket cause an error if the call is not in active state

Returns:
Socket uded for data communication

DateTime MmCallHdl::GetStartTime (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the time when the call was established. The MmCallHdl shall contain a valid CallIndex. See also GetPhoneNumber().

Returns:
A DateTime object containing the time the call was established. Contains 0 if applied to a non existent call.

virtual void MmCallHdl::Invalidate (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Sets the reference of a MmCallHdl object to the void reference.

BOOLEAN MmCallHdl::IsAcceptPermitted (   )  const
 

Returns:
TRUE if the preconditions for accepting an mtc are fulfilled.

BOOLEAN MmCallHdl::IsActive (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE if the given MmCallHdl refers to the active call, FALSE otherwise (also when containing a void reference).

BOOLEAN MmCallHdl::IsInSetup (   )  const
 

Returns TRUE if the given MmCallHdl refers to the call in setup phase, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN MmCallHdl::IsMobileOriginated (   )  const
 

Returns TRUE if the MmCallHdl refers to a mobile originated call, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN MmCallHdl::IsMobileTerminated (   )  const
 

Returns TRUE if the MmCallHdl refers to a mobile terminated call, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN MmCallHdl::IsPsdCallActive (   )  [static]
 

Returns wheter a PSD call is currently active

Returns:
TRUE if at least one PSD call is currently active, FALSE otherwise

BOOLEAN MmCallHdl::IsSetupPermitted (   )  const
 

Returns:
TRUE if the preconditions for a moc (voice) are fulfilled.

BOOLEAN MmCallHdl::IsValid (   )  const [virtual]
 

An MmCallHdl object is valid if it's reference is different to the void reference.

Returns:
FALSE - If the reference is the void reference.
TRUE - Otherwise.

BOOLEAN MmCallHdl::operator== (  const MmCallHdl &  call  )  const
 

Checks the CallIndices of both MmCallHdl objects.

Returns:
TRUE - If both objects refer to the same call.
FALSE - If the references are different or both objects keep a void reference.

CallApiRc MmCallHdl::Reject (  ClearCause  cause = SubscriberBusy,
BOOLEAN  wait_condition = FALSE
) 
 

Releases a mobile terminated multimedia call before it is accepted and sends the calling party information about the cause for the release.

Parameters:
cause The default cause SubscriberBusy, is used when the called user has indicated the inability to accept another call.
Returns:
See CallHdl::Release.

CallApiRc MmCallHdl::RejectAllMtc (  BOOLEAN  activate  )  [static]
 

Enables/disables blocking of all mobile terminated calls.

Parameters:
activate TRUE activates, FALSE deactivates blocking.
Returns:
NoError - If blocking successfully enabled or disabled. CallDataLocked if another thread currently blocks the internal data structures.

CallApiRc MmCallHdl::Release (  TimeSpan *  calling_time = 0,
BOOLEAN  wait_condition = FALSE
)  [virtual]
 

Releases a mobile terminated or mobile originated multimedia call. May be invoked during call setup and call active phase. The internal data will be updated immediately. The CallIndex of the MmCallHdl is set to c_null_call_index. Refer to the documentation of CallApiRc for a detailed description of the return values.

Parameters:
calling_time - Is set to the call duration (time span).
wait_condition TRUE for synchronous waiting of release
Returns:
NoError - If executed successfully. In case of error, one of the following values will be returned: CallDataLocked, InvalidCallIndex, UnexpectedResult.

void MmCallHdl::ReportCurrentCallMeter (  BOOLEAN  activate  )  [static]
 

Starts automatic reporting of current call meter (CCM). The message MmCurrentCallMeterMsg will be sent each time when the CCM is calculated until the automatic reporting is stopped by calling this method with parameter activate set to FALSE.

Parameters:
activate Starts reporting of CCM if TRUE, stops reporting if FALSE.

void MmCallHdl::ReportCurrentCharge (  BOOLEAN  activate  )  [static]
 

Starts automatic reporting of current charge. The message MmCurrentChargeMsg will be sent each time when the CCM is calculated (but not more than once within 2 seconds) until the automatic reporting is stopped by calling this method with parameter activate set to FALSE.

Parameters:
activate Starts reporting of current charge if TRUE, stops reporting if FALSE.

CallApiRc MmCallHdl::Setup (  const PhoneNumber &  phone_no,
ClirMode  clir_mode = DontCare
) 
 

Establishes a mobile originated multimedia call. Assigns the CallIndex in the MmCallHdl as soon it is available by the AT interface and returns NoError, if the call setup was successful. In case of any error, the CallIndex will be set to c_null_call_index. During the execution of Setup(const PhoneNumber & phone_no), several info-messages are sent (active wait loop). The messages supply information on setup progress and are the following: MmMocSetupAcceptMsg, MmCallStatusMsg, and MmCallSetupProgressMsg. Refer to the documentation of CallApiRc for a detailed description of the return values. The CLIR mode is defaulted to the network settings.

Parameters:
phone_no The phone number of the call to be set up.
clir_mode SuppressPhoneNumber or DisplayPhoneNumber. By default DontCare will be used.
Returns:
NoError - If executed successfully. In case of error one of the following values will be returned: CallDataLocked, NoNetwork, ActiveCallDetected, SetupCallDetected, MaxCallCountExceeded, CallDisconnected, CallSetupRejected.
